Company Profile.description: Full legal name of the company
Company Profile.AI-instruction: Extract the complete legal entity name of the company, including any Ltd, Inc, PLC, GmbH, SA designations. Usually on the cover page or header.

Company Profile.description: Trading or brand name if different from legal name
Company Profile.AI-instruction: Extract the trading or commercial name if it differs from the legal name (e.g., 'Alphabet' vs 'Alphabet Inc.').
Extract the official company registration number assigned by the registration authority. Format varies by jurisdiction.
Extract the tax identification number, VAT number, or EIN. Look in company details or footer sections.
Extract the 20-character LEI code if provided. This is an international identifier for legal entities.
Extract the stock ticker symbol(s). Include exchange identifier if provided (e.g., 'AAPL' or 'NASDAQ:AAPL').
Extract the name of the primary stock exchange (e.g., NYSE, NASDAQ, LSE, Euronext, Frankfurt).
Company Profile.allowed_values: NYSE, NASDAQ, LSE, Euronext Paris, Euronext Amsterdam, Frankfurt, SIX Swiss, Tokyo, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Private/Unlisted

Company Profile.AI-instruction: Extract the date when the company was incorporated. Format as DD-MM-YYYY.
Extract the country or state where the company is incorporated (e.g., Delaware USA, England & Wales, Netherlands).
Extract the primary industry sector classification. Use standard classifications like GICS, ICB, or NAICS.
Extract a concise description of the company's main business activities. Usually 1-3 sentences from company overview.
Extract the complete headquarters address including street, city, postal code, and country.
Extract just the country name from the headquarters address.
Extract the total employee headcount. May be stated as a range or specific number. Use the midpoint if a range.
Extract the company's official website URL. Include https:// if shown.
Extract the name of the audit firm (e.g., Deloitte, PwC, EY, KPMG, BDO). Look in auditor's report section.
Company Profile.allowed_values: Deloitte, PricewaterhouseCoopers, Ernst & Young, KPMG, BDO, Grant Thornton, RSM, Mazars, Crowe, Baker Tilly, Other

Company Profile.AI-instruction: Extract the audit opinion: Unqualified/Clean, Qualified, Adverse, or Disclaimer. Look in the auditor's report.
Company Profile.allowed_values: Unqualified, Qualified, Adverse, Disclaimer of Opinion

Financial Period.AI-instruction: This field links back to Company Profile. Use the same company legal name.
Extract the fiscal year as a 4-digit number (e.g., 2024). This is the year the fiscal period ends.
Extract the period type: Annual, Q1, Q2, Q3, Q4, H1 (half-year), or YTD.
Financial Period.allowed_values: Annual, Q1, Q2, Q3, Q4, H1, H2, YTD

Financial Period.description: First day of the fiscal period
Financial Period.AI-instruction: Extract the start date of this fiscal period. Format as DD-MM-YYYY.

Financial Period.description: Last day of the fiscal period
Financial Period.AI-instruction: Extract the end date of this fiscal period. Format as DD-MM-YYYY. This is the 'as of' date for the report.
Extract the reporting currency (EUR, USD, GBP, etc.). Usually stated near financial statements.
Financial Period.allowed_values: EUR, USD, GBP, CHF, JPY, CNY, AUD, CAD, SEK, NOK, DKK

Financial Period.AI-instruction: Extract how amounts are presented: Ones, Thousands, Millions, Billions. Look for statements like 'in thousands'.
Extract the accounting standard: IFRS, US GAAP, UK GAAP, Local GAAP, etc. Usually stated in notes to accounts.
Financial Period.allowed_values: IFRS, US GAAP, UK GAAP, German HGB, French GAAP, Dutch GAAP, Other

Financial Period.AI-instruction: Identify the report type: Audited Annual Report, Unaudited Quarterly, Interim Report, Preliminary Results, etc.
Financial Period.allowed_values: Audited Annual Report, Unaudited Quarterly Report, Interim Report, Preliminary Results, Management Accounts

Financial Period.AI-instruction: Determine if these are Consolidated (group) or Standalone (parent only) financial statements.
Extract the date this report was published or filed. Format as DD-MM-YYYY.

Income Statement.AI-instruction: This field links back to Company Profile. Use the same company legal name.
This field links back to Financial Period. Use the same fiscal year.
This field links back to Financial Period. Use the same fiscal period.

Income Statement.description: Category of the income statement line item
Income Statement.AI-instruction: Classify the line item into major categories: Revenue, Cost of Revenue, Operating Expenses, Operating Income, Non-Operating, Tax, Net Income, etc.
Income Statement.allowed_values: Revenue, Cost of Revenue, Gross Profit, Operating Expenses, Operating Income, Non-Operating Income, Non-Operating Expenses, Pretax Income, Tax Expense, Net Income, Other Comprehensive Income

Income Statement.description: Specific name of the line item
Income Statement.AI-instruction: Extract the exact line item name from the income statement (e.g., 'Revenue from sale of goods', 'Research & Development', 'Interest expense').
Extract the monetary amount for this line item in the current period. Include negative sign for expenses if shown in parentheses.

Income Statement.description: Comparative amount for the prior period
Income Statement.AI-instruction: Extract the comparative amount from the previous year/period if shown. Include negative sign for expenses if applicable.
Calculate or extract the difference between current and prior period. Positive = increase, Negative = decrease.
Calculate or extract the percentage change from prior period. Express as percentage (e.g., 15.5 for 15.5% growth).

Income Statement.description: Line item as percentage of total revenue
Income Statement.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract this line item as a percentage of total revenue (margin analysis). Common for margin ratios.

Balance Sheet.AI-instruction: This field links back to Company Profile. Use the same company legal name.
This field links back to Financial Period. Use the same fiscal year.
This field links back to Financial Period. Use the same fiscal period.

Balance Sheet.description: Major category on the balance sheet
Balance Sheet.AI-instruction: Classify the line item: Current Assets, Non-Current Assets, Current Liabilities, Non-Current Liabilities, Equity, etc.
Balance Sheet.allowed_values: Current Assets, Non-Current Assets, Total Assets, Current Liabilities, Non-Current Liabilities, Total Liabilities, Equity, Total Liabilities and Equity

Balance Sheet.AI-instruction: Provide more granular classification (e.g., 'Cash & Equivalents', 'Inventory', 'Property Plant Equipment', 'Long-term Debt', 'Retained Earnings').

Balance Sheet.description: Specific name of the balance sheet line item
Balance Sheet.AI-instruction: Extract the exact line item name from the balance sheet as it appears in the statement.

Balance Sheet.description: Amount as of current period end
Balance Sheet.AI-instruction: Extract the monetary amount for this line item as of the current period end date.
Extract the comparative amount as of the prior period end date if shown.
Calculate or extract the absolute change from prior period.
Calculate or extract the percentage change from prior period.

Balance Sheet.description: Line item as percentage of total assets
Balance Sheet.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract this line item as a percentage of total assets for composition analysis.

Cash Flow Statement.AI-instruction: This field links back to Company Profile. Use the same company legal name.
This field links back to Financial Period. Use the same fiscal year.
This field links back to Financial Period. Use the same fiscal period.
Classify into one of the three main categories: Operating Activities, Investing Activities, or Financing Activities.
Cash Flow Statement.allowed_values: Operating Activities, Investing Activities, Financing Activities, Net Change in Cash

Cash Flow Statement.description: Specific cash flow line item name
Cash Flow Statement.AI-instruction: Extract the exact line item name (e.g., 'Depreciation and amortization', 'Purchase of property and equipment', 'Proceeds from issuance of debt').

Cash Flow Statement.description: Cash flow amount for current period
Cash Flow Statement.AI-instruction: Extract the cash flow amount. Positive = cash inflow, Negative = cash outflow. Respect the sign conventions used.

Cash Flow Statement.description: Comparative cash flow from prior period
Cash Flow Statement.AI-instruction: Extract the comparative cash flow amount from the prior period if shown.

Cash Flow Statement.description: Change in cash flow from prior period
Cash Flow Statement.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract the change in cash flow compared to prior period.

Cash Flow Statement.description: Whether this represents a cash inflow
Cash Flow Statement.AI-instruction: Determine if this is a cash inflow (True) or outflow (False) based on the amount and context.

Financial Ratios.description: Reference to company name
Financial Ratios.AI-instruction: This field links back to Company Profile. Use the same company legal name.

Financial Ratios.description: Reference to fiscal year
Financial Ratios.AI-instruction: This field links back to Financial Period. Use the same fiscal year.

Financial Ratios.description: Reference to fiscal period
Financial Ratios.AI-instruction: This field links back to Financial Period. Use the same fiscal period.

Financial Ratios.description: Gross profit as percentage of revenue
Financial Ratios.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract: (Gross Profit / Revenue) × 100. Express as percentage.

Financial Ratios.description: Operating profit (EBIT) as percentage of revenue
Financial Ratios.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract: (Operating Income / Revenue) × 100. Also called EBIT margin.

Financial Ratios.description: Net income as percentage of revenue
Financial Ratios.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract: (Net Income / Revenue) × 100. The bottom-line profitability metric.

Financial Ratios.description: ROA - Net income divided by total assets
Financial Ratios.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract: (Net Income / Total Assets) × 100. Measures asset efficiency.

Financial Ratios.description: ROE - Net income divided by shareholders' equity
Financial Ratios.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract: (Net Income / Shareholders' Equity) × 100. Key profitability metric for investors.

Financial Ratios.description: Current assets divided by current liabilities
Financial Ratios.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract: Current Assets / Current Liabilities. Liquidity measure (typically 1-3).

Financial Ratios.description: Acid test ratio - liquid assets divided by current liabilities
Financial Ratios.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract: (Current Assets - Inventory) / Current Liabilities. Stringent liquidity measure.

Financial Ratios.description: Total debt divided by shareholders' equity
Financial Ratios.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract: Total Debt / Shareholders' Equity. Leverage metric (expressed as ratio, e.g., 0.5).

Financial Ratios.description: Total debt as percentage of total assets
Financial Ratios.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract: (Total Debt / Total Assets) × 100. Alternative leverage measure.

Financial Ratios.description: EBIT divided by interest expense
Financial Ratios.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract: EBIT / Interest Expense. Measures ability to service debt (times).

Financial Ratios.description: Revenue divided by total assets
Financial Ratios.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract: Revenue / Total Assets. Measures asset efficiency (times).

Financial Ratios.description: Cost of goods sold divided by average inventory
Financial Ratios.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract: COGS / Average Inventory. How many times inventory is sold per year.

Financial Ratios.description: Average collection period for receivables in days
Financial Ratios.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract: (Accounts Receivable / Revenue) × 365. Average days to collect payment.

Financial Ratios.description: Current assets minus current liabilities
Financial Ratios.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract: Current Assets - Current Liabilities. Available operating liquidity.

Financial Ratios.description: Earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortization
Financial Ratios.AI-instruction: Extract or calculate EBITDA. This is a common profitability metric especially for leveraged companies.

Financial Ratios.description: EBITDA as percentage of revenue
Financial Ratios.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract: (EBITDA / Revenue) × 100. Common margin metric.

Financial Ratios.description: Operating cash flow minus capital expenditures
Financial Ratios.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract: Operating Cash Flow - Capital Expenditures. Cash available after maintaining assets.

Segment Performance.AI-instruction: This field links back to Company Profile. Use the same company legal name.
This field links back to Financial Period. Use the same fiscal year.
This field links back to Financial Period. Use the same fiscal period.

Segment Performance.description: Name of the business segment or division
Segment Performance.AI-instruction: Extract the segment name from segment reporting (e.g., 'Consumer Electronics', 'Cloud Services', 'Pharmaceuticals'). Look in segment reporting notes.
Extract the revenue attributable to this business segment.
Extract the operating profit/EBIT for this segment. May also be called 'Segment Result'.
Calculate or extract: (Segment Operating Income / Segment Revenue) × 100.

Segment Performance.description: Total assets allocated to this segment
Segment Performance.AI-instruction: Extract the total assets allocated to or used by this segment if disclosed.
Extract the capital expenditure (CapEx) for this segment if disclosed separately.

Segment Performance.description: Segment revenue as percentage of total company revenue
Segment Performance.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract this segment's contribution to total company revenue as a percentage.

Segment Performance.description: Year-over-year revenue growth for this segment
Segment Performance.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract the YoY growth rate for this segment's revenue.

Geographic Breakdown.AI-instruction: This field links back to Company Profile. Use the same company legal name.
This field links back to Financial Period. Use the same fiscal year.
This field links back to Financial Period. Use the same fiscal period.
Extract the geographic region or country from segment reporting (e.g., 'EMEA', 'Americas', 'Asia Pacific', 'United States', 'China').
Extract the revenue generated in this geographic region.
Extract the operating income generated in this region if disclosed separately.

Geographic Breakdown.description: Non-current assets located in this region
Geographic Breakdown.AI-instruction: Extract the non-current assets (PP&E, goodwill, etc.) located in this region if disclosed.

Geographic Breakdown.description: Region revenue as percentage of total company revenue
Geographic Breakdown.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract this region's contribution to total revenue as a percentage.

Geographic Breakdown.description: Year-over-year revenue growth for this region
Geographic Breakdown.AI-instruction: Calculate or extract the YoY growth rate for this region's revenue.

Key Executives.AI-instruction: This field links back to Company Profile. Use the same company legal name.
Extract the full name of the executive officer or board member. Look in corporate governance or management section.
Extract the official title (e.g., 'Chief Executive Officer', 'Chief Financial Officer', 'Non-Executive Director', 'Chairman').
Classify the position: Executive Management, Board of Directors, or Advisory Board.
Key Executives.allowed_values: Executive Management, Board of Directors, Advisory Board, Other

Key Executives.AI-instruction: Extract the date this person was appointed to their current position. Format as DD-MM-YYYY.

Key Executives.description: Total compensation for the reporting period
Key Executives.AI-instruction: Extract total compensation including salary, bonus, equity awards, etc. Look in remuneration report.

Key Executives.description: Whether the board member is independent
Key Executives.AI-instruction: For board members, determine if they are classified as independent (True) or non-independent (False). Not applicable for executives.

Subsidiaries.AI-instruction: This field links back to Company Profile. Use the same company legal name.
Extract the full legal name of the subsidiary company. Look in notes about group structure or list of subsidiaries.
Extract where the subsidiary is incorporated (e.g., 'Delaware, USA', 'Netherlands', 'Singapore').
Extract the ownership stake as a percentage (e.g., 100 for wholly-owned, 51 for majority stake).

Subsidiaries.description: Main business activity of the subsidiary
Subsidiaries.AI-instruction: Extract a brief description of what this subsidiary does (e.g., 'Manufacturing', 'Sales and distribution', 'Holding company').

Subsidiaries.description: Whether the subsidiary is considered material
Subsidiaries.AI-instruction: Determine if this subsidiary is specifically disclosed as material to the group (True) or is just listed (False).

Debt Schedule.AI-instruction: This field links back to Company Profile. Use the same company legal name.
This field links back to Financial Period. Use the same fiscal year.

Debt Schedule.description: Unique identifier for the debt instrument
Debt Schedule.AI-instruction: Extract the instrument identifier (ISIN, CUSIP, or internal reference). This uniquely identifies this specific debt issuance.

Debt Schedule.description: Name or description of the debt instrument
Debt Schedule.AI-instruction: Extract the name of the debt facility (e.g., 'Senior Secured Notes 2028', 'Revolving Credit Facility', 'Term Loan B').
Classify the debt type: Senior Bond, Subordinated Bond, Bank Loan, Credit Facility, Lease Obligation, Other.
Debt Schedule.allowed_values: Senior Secured Bond, Senior Unsecured Bond, Subordinated Bond, Convertible Bond, Bank Loan, Revolving Credit Facility, Term Loan, Lease Liability, Other

Debt Schedule.AI-instruction: Extract the current outstanding principal balance of this debt instrument.
Extract the currency denomination of the debt (EUR, USD, GBP, etc.).
Debt Schedule.allowed_values: EUR, USD, GBP, CHF, JPY, CNY, AUD, CAD, SEK, NOK

Debt Schedule.AI-instruction: Extract the interest rate as a percentage. For floating rates, extract the margin over reference rate.
Determine if the interest rate is Fixed or Floating (variable).
Extract the maturity or repayment date. Format as DD-MM-YYYY.
Extract the original issue date of this debt instrument. Format as DD-MM-YYYY.
Determine if the debt is secured (True) or unsecured (False) by collateral.
Extract the credit rating for this instrument if disclosed (S&P, Moody's, or Fitch notation).

Share Capital.AI-instruction: This field links back to Company Profile. Use the same company legal name.
This field links back to Financial Period. Use the same fiscal year.

Share Capital.description: Class of shares (e.g., Ordinary, Preference, Class A)
Share Capital.AI-instruction: Extract the share class designation (e.g., 'Ordinary Shares', 'Class A Common Stock', 'Preference Shares').
Extract the total number of shares authorized to be issued for this class.
Extract the total number of shares that have been issued for this class.
Extract the number of shares currently outstanding (issued minus treasury shares).

Share Capital.description: Par or nominal value per share
Share Capital.AI-instruction: Extract the par value or nominal value per share. May be stated as 'no par value'.
Extract the voting rights (e.g., 'One vote per share', 'Non-voting', 'Ten votes per share').
Extract any special dividend rights or preferences for this share class.

master_instruction_config.text:
This document contains comprehensive financial statements and corporate information. Pay careful attention to:

1. Currency and Scale: Note whether amounts are in thousands, millions, or billions. Maintain the currency notation exactly as presented.

2. Accounting Standards: Different jurisdictions use different accounting standards (IFRS vs GAAP vs local GAAP). Terminology may vary (e.g., 'Turnover' vs 'Revenue', 'Profit' vs 'Income').

3. Negative Values: Watch for parentheses indicating negative numbers, particularly in expenses and losses. Maintain the sign convention.

4. Dates: Format all dates as DD-MM-YYYY. Be aware that fiscal years may not align with calendar years.

5. Comparative Periods: Many statements show current year and prior year side-by-side. Ensure you extract from the correct column.

6. Notes References: Line items often have note references (e.g., Note 15). These provide additional detail but don't need to be extracted as part of the line item name.

7. Subtotals vs Line Items: Distinguish between actual line items and subtotal/total lines. Both may be relevant but serve different purposes.

8. Segment Reporting: Business and geographic segments are usually disclosed in separate notes. Extract each segment as a separate record.

9. Related Party Transactions: These may be disclosed separately and should be noted if material.

10. Rounding: Be aware that figures may be rounded and totals may not sum exactly due to rounding differences.
